sentence.text: Aberrant expression of different family members of the positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion/ephrin system, which comprises the Eph receptors (Ephs) and their ligands (ephrins), has been implicated in various malignancies including breast cancer.
This review reflects the existing positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion/ephrin literature while focusing on breast cancer heterogeneity.
positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesionA2, EphB4 and EphB6 are the members most extensively studied in breast cancer.

Existing research points to the potential use of various positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion/ephrin members as biomarkers for assessing prognosis and selecting the most suitable therapeutic strategies in variable clinical scenarios, also for overcoming drug resistance, in the era of breast cancer heterogeneity
